title: Micheál Martin - Wikipedia
snippet: Micheál Martin (Irish: [ˈmʲiːçaːl̪ˠ]; born 16 August 1960) is an Irish Fianna Fáil politician serving as Taoiseach since January 2025, having previously held the position from 2020 to 2022. Martin served as Tánaiste, Minister for Foreign Affairs and Minister for Defence from December ...

title: Micheal Martin | Taoiseach, Previous Offices, & Family Tragedy | Britannica
snippet: When Ahern became taoiseach after the 1997 elections, he made Martin, then age 36, minister of education and science, a portfolio that would remain his until 2000. Thereafter Martin held a number of prominent posts in Ahern’s cabinet and that of his successor as Fianna Fáil leader and taoiseach, Brian Cowen.

title: Government of the 34th Dáil - Wikipedia
snippet: After his appointment as Taoiseach by the president, Martin proposed the members of the government and they were approved by the Dáil. They were appointed by the president on the same day. ^ The Minister for Foreign Affairs was retitled the Minister for Foreign Affairs and Trade on 26 March 2025.

title: Micheál Martin - Taoiseach and Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil. TD for Cork South Central. | LinkedIn
snippet: Taoiseach and Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil. TD for Cork South Central. · Taoiseach and Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil, TD for Cork South Central. Tánaiste & Minister for Foreign Affairs & Minister for Defence from 2022 to 2025. Taoiseach from 2020 to 2022 Elected Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil on the 26th of January 2011 Minister for Foreign Affairs (May 2008 - January 2011) Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment (September 2004 - May 2008) Minister for Health and Children (January 2000 - September 2004) Minister for Education (June 1997 - January 2000) Fianna Fáil Front Bench spokesperson on Education and the Gaeltacht (1995 - 1997) I am a former Chairman of the Oireachtas All Party Committee on the Irish Language.
